notesSummary: 12/08: Admission for Severe AUD; client intoxicated and disoriented.
12/10: BPS completed; identified significant history of complex trauma.
12/12: Transitioned from Simmons Detox to McClay Residential care.
12/15: Initiated Acamprosate for MAT; addressed somatic throat constriction symptoms.
12/19: Processed grief regarding son's missed visit and housing instability.
12/23: Disclosed detailed history of IPV and childhood sexual abuse.
12/26: Progress noted in emotional regulation and use of trauma-focused yoga.
12/31: Final note indicates shift from victim identity toward empowerment.
clinicalCycle.barriersToStepDown: High potential for emotional destabilization during trauma processing; active housing instability due to ex-husband's threat to sell residence; persistent hypervigilance (ASAM D3, D5, D6).
clinicalCycle.reasonsForStepDown: Stable vital signs; compliant with all medications (MAT); active engagement in CPTSD workbook; emerging interoceptive awareness.
clinicalCycle.remedies: Confirm placement at Avery Lane or Honeycomb Wellness for IOP/SLE; establish care with local PCP and outpatient therapist; finalize mortgage refinancing.

reviews.clinicalNotes: Patient cleared detox; requires residential containment for trauma and SI history.
Continued clinical necessity due to hyperarousal and relapse risk.
Approved through anticipated discharge for stabilization.

assessment.precipitatingEvent: Son leaving for college (empty nest) combined with ex-husband's legal threats to sell her home and force her out.

mentalStatus.appearance: Disheveled at admit; later casual and appropriate.
mentalStatus.affect: Labile and Blunted; transitioned to Congruent/Jovial.
mentalStatus.risk: History of SA (8 years ago, wrist slitting); current passive SI (no plan).

assessment.biomedicalConditions: Chronic Insomnia; Somatic throat constriction; Hyperarousal/Startle response.
assessment.medications: Acamprosate, Gabapentin, Trazodone, Melatonin, Clonidine, Acetaminophen.
assessment.substanceUseHistory: Heavy alcohol use for 30+ years; 2 bottles of wine daily; drinking since morning of admit.
assessment.treatmentHistory: 5150 hold 7 years ago (Marin General); previous 6-8 month sobriety; failed outpatient therapy.

psychosocialStressors.housing: High risk; ex-husband trying to sell her condo.
psychosocialStressors.employment: Currently on medical leave; work partner found treatment.
psychosocialStressors.relationships: Divorced; narcissistic/abusive ex; son in college.

assessment.barriersToDischarge: Inadequate independent coping capacity outside controlled environment; lack of safe stable housing.
assessment.treatmentPlanGoals: Achieve and maintain sobriety from alcohol. Process unresolved complex trauma. Establish a safe and stable living situation.
assessment.dischargePlan: Step-down to Avery Lane IOP/SLE for continued trauma work and housing stability.

perspectives_reclaim.theme: Internal Transition: From Victimhood to Empowerment

the_narrative.original_state: Upon admission, the client presented as disheveled, disoriented, and deeply entrenched in a 'victim-based' identity. She conceptualized her former partner as an 'addiction' and her drinking as a 'byproduct of all the trauma,' describing a sense of being 'underwater' and 'trapped' by her past.
the_narrative.reclaimed_state: By the end of the clinical cycle, Megan moved toward a self-empowered stance. She began conceptualizing her recovery as an 'internal transition,' explicitly seeking to reclaim personal autonomy and a version of herself she remembers from before her marriageâ€”one who was competent and in control.

clinical_milestones.description: Transitioned from experiencing trauma as physical 'throat constriction' and 'shallow breathing' to actively using trauma-focused yoga and guided breathwork to 'vocalize' and release stored tension.
clinical_milestones.outcome: Improved interoceptive awareness and emotional regulation.

clinical_milestones.description: Moved from viewing herself as 'stuck' to viewing her anger toward her ex-partner as 'earned' and valid, allowing her to process fear without resorting to substance use for numbing.

Identified a personal, 'universal version' of spirituality (influenced by Thich Nhat Hanh), replacing feelings of isolation with a sense of being 'connected' to a higher power for the first time in years.

strengths_reclaimed: Resilience as a Parent and Pet Owner

patient_voice.key_quote_1: I want this trauma out... it's like I have a fishing hook in me and I just want to pull it out.
patient_voice.key_quote_2: I'm tired of carrying around all this other stuff. I want to be the whole human I want to be.
patient_voice.key_quote_3: I need a safe and supportive setting to engage in trauma therapy... I'm looking forward to being happy again.

reclamation_plan.focus: Addressing the 'bricks' of trauma through continued CPTSD workbook application.
reclamation_plan.objective: Establish an independent life free from the ex-partner's control, focusing on 'peace and calm' through mortgage refinancing and a stable recovery environment (SLE).
reclamation_plan.next_step: Step-down to Avery Lane or Honeycomb Wellness to bridge residential insights into real-world autonomy.
